ticket.title: ActiveRecord's to_json method ignores timezone when serializing Time objects
ticket.original-body:
Simple example to demonstrate (tested in Rails 2.3.5):
now = Time.parse("Thu Jun 24 15:41:23 UTC 2010") now2 = Time.parse(now.to_json)
check these results out: puts now => Thu Jun 24 15:41:23 UTC 2010 puts now2 => Thu Jun 24 11:41:23 -0400 2010
They're different!
This is because: now.to_json => "\"2010/06/24 15:41:23 +0000\"" as you can see, the timezone is incorrectly specified
